devdoc.details: Note the deployed token starts out with no config at Liquidity contract. This must be done by Liquidity auths in a separate step, otherwise no deposits will be possible. This contract is not upgradeable. It supports adding new iToken creation codes for future new iToken types.

params.iTokenType_: type of iToken: - if it's the native token, it should use `NativeUnderlying` - otherwise it should use `iToken` - could be more types available, check `iTokenTypes()`

returns.token_: detemrinistic address of the computed token

params.iTokenType_: type of iToken: - if it's the native token, it should use `NativeUnderlying` - otherwise it should use `iToken` - could be more types available, check `iTokenTypes()`
params.isNativeUnderlying_: flag to signal iToken type that uses native underlying at Liquidity

params.allowed_: bool flag for whether address is allowed as auth or not
params.auth_: address to set auth value for

params.allowed_: bool flag for whether address is allowed as deployer or not
params.deployer_: address to set deployer value for

params.creationCode_: contract creation code. can be set to bytes(0) to remove a previously available `iTokenType_`
params.iTokenType_: the iToken Type used to refer the creation code

devdoc.title: Fluid LendingFactory

LogSetAuth(address,bool).notice: emitted when an auth is modified by owner

LogSetDeployer(address,bool).notice: emitted when a deployer is modified by owner

LogSetITokenCreationCode(string,address).notice: emitted when the creation code for an iTokenType is set

LogTokenCreated(address,address,uint256,.notice: emitted when a new iToken is created

computeToken(address,string).notice: computes deterministic token address for `asset_` for a lending protocol

createToken(address,string,bool).notice: creates token for `asset_` for a lending protocol with interest. Only callable by deployers.

iTokenCreationCode(string).notice: returns the creation code for a certain `iTokenType_`

iTokenTypes().notice: list of all iToken types that can be deployed

isAuth(address).notice: reads if a certain `auth_` address is an allowed auth or not. Owner is auth by default.

isDeployer(address).notice: reads if a certain `deployer_` address is an allowed deployer or not. Owner is deployer by default.

setAuth(address,bool).notice: Sets an address as allowed auth or not. Only callable by owner.

setDeployer(address,bool).notice: Sets an address as allowed deployer or not. Only callable by owner.

setITokenCreationCode(string,bytes).notice: Sets the `creationCode_` bytecode for a certain `iTokenType_`. Only callable by auths.

userdoc.notice: creates Fluid lending protocol iTokens, which are interacting with Fluid Liquidity. iTokens are ERC20 & ERC4626 compatible tokens that allow to deposit to Fluid Liquidity to earn interest. Tokens are created at a deterministic address (see `computeToken()`), only executable by allow-listed auths.
